title: If you set a Guinness World Record, do they pay you money? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks from the outset. Records are registry of a feat unachieved by any others in any given field. Record Breakers: Theory to surpass an already achieved and recorded feat. Formula to Break: Determination, long hours, clear focus, conventional, orthodox and a never give up attitude. Record Creators: Theoritically to create a name for yourself by accomplishing something unique, which no one else has done before. Formula to create: Creativity, Uniqueness, unconventional, unorthodox, desire to prove a point., etc. Whatever be the intentions or purpose. You don’t get paid, by the competent body for setting a New Guiness World Record. Probably get a medal, citation and find your name in the book of Guiness Record. Part of History. Well, on the other hand, if I were to set a Unique record that will stand unbeaten till my last journey. I will try making money by offering my services and expertise to those seeking to emulate and dethrone me. I will teach everything but not the secret to overpower me. I would’ve made a sizable chunk of money. Now, What do I do that’s Unique and a world beater? Thinking…………………………………………

Exactly the opposite. If you want to set or break a record, you have to pay them. Although it's possible to apply for free, the application process will give you headache and it'll be slow (3 months to process application and additional 3 months to know if you succeeded). If you want your application processed within 5 working days, you need to pay $800 if you want to break existing record or $1000 if you want to set a new record title. If you want to quickly know (within 5 working days) if you succeeded, you need to pay additional $650. If you want everything immediately, you can pay to get dedicated account manager who will also help you in the application process. The price is revealed on request. There are more paid services. Check this: Priority Applications & Priority Evidence Review
